title: DHS Slams Billie Eilish‚Äôs ‚ÄòGarbage Rhetoric‚Äô About ICE After Singer Shares Posts Criticizing Minneapolis¬†Shooting
summary: "The officer was in fear of his own life," the department insisted in a statement to Billboard.
body: The United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is hitting back at Billie Eilish after the singer reshared a series of posts on her Instagram Story calling ICE a “terrorist group” in light of the fatal shooting of a woman in Minneapolis earlier this week. Related Billie Eilish Shares Posts Calling ICE a ‘Terrorist Group’ in Light of Minneapolis Shooting Billie Eilish Pushes for Gun Control Amid ‘Devastating’ Shootings in U.S. & Australia: ‘Raise Your Voice’ John Mulaney Postpones Minneapolis Shows Following ICE Killing of Renee Nicole Good: ‘What’s Happening in Your City Is Heartbreaking’ In a statement shared with Billboard late Friday night (Jan. 9), DHS assistant secretary Tricia McLaughlin began, “Clearly, Billie Eilish has not seen the newly released footage, which corroborates what DHS has stated all along ‚Äî that this individual was impeding law enforcement and weaponized her vehicle in an attempt to kill or cause bodily harm to federal law enforcement.” Sharing a link to a video on X of the Jan. 7 shooting ‚Äî seemingly taken by the officer who pulled the trigger, later identif‚Ä¶

title: Washington National Opera Cutting Ties With Kennedy Center Following Trump¬†Renaming
summary: Artists ranging from Lin-Manuel Miranda to Peter Wolf have recently called off events at the venue.
body: The Washington National Opera announced Friday (Jan. 9) that it will move performances away from the Kennedy Center in another high-profile departure following President Donald Trump‚Äôs takeover of the U.S. capital‚Äôs leading performing arts venue. The opera said it will seek to end its affiliation with the Kennedy Center through an ‚Äúamicable transition‚Äù and will return to operating independently. It cited financial constraints imposed after Trump fired the Kennedy Center‚Äôs board and installed allies to oversee it. Related Why Peter Wolf Finally Got Around to Writing His Memoir (And Canceled on the Kennedy Center) Kennedy Center Board Votes to Rename Washington D.C. Landmark After President Trump Banjoist B√©la Fleck Pulls Out of Kennedy Center Concert The opera will reduce its spring season and move performances to other venues ‚Äúto ensure fiscal prudence and fulfill its obligations for a balanced budget,‚Äù the opera said in a statement. The statement did not mention Trump or the decision by the Kennedy Center‚Äôs new board to add the president‚Äôs name to the venue. Though Congress still formally calls it the John F. title: Yungblud Sparks Fan Frenzy at Sydney Gallery, Goes Commando on¬†Yacht
summary: Yungblud‚Äôs arrival in Australia ahead of the kickoff of his IDOLS World Tour has been anything but low-key.
body: Yungblud‚Äôs arrival in Australia ahead of the kickoff of his IDOLS World Tour has been anything but low-key. The British rocker touched down in Sydney earlier this week and quickly drew massive fan attention after attending a pop-up photo gallery exhibition in Newtown, where crowds reportedly became so large that police were called to manage the situation. The event, titled Yungblud: IDOLS , featured photography by British photographer Tom Pallant and showcased images from previous legs of the singer‚Äôs ongoing tour. Yungblud ‚Äî born Dominic Harrison ‚Äî had encouraged fans to attend the gallery via social media, telling them he would be there in person. Hundreds reportedly queued for hours to catch a glimpse of the artist, with some lining up from early morning. Though no major incidents were reported, the turnout was large enough that authorities asked the event to wrap earlier than planned. ‚ÄúYo guys, I love you so much, thank you for coming out,‚Äù Yungblud said in a voice memo shared to fans afterward. ‚ÄúThat got a bit f‚Äîing hectic, didn‚Äôt it? The cops said we had to move on because it was just getting mad.‚Äù The exhibition is scheduled to run through Jan. 11, with fans lining up as ea‚Ä¶

title: Ganges Delta Under a Winter Shroud of Fog
summary: Low clouds blanketed the delta while parallel cloud bands rolled over the Bay of Bengal during a January cold wave.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Ganges Delta Under a Winter‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us January 6, 2026 Winter weather took hold across the Indo-Gangetic Plain in early January 2026, bringing dense fog and cold temperatures to much of the flat, fertile lands that span from Pakistan and northern India to Bangladesh. This image shows low-lying clouds over the delta on the morning of January 6, captured by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASA‚Äôs Terra satellite. Dense fog, particularly radiation fog , is common this time of year, forming when ground temperatures are cool, winds are light, and moisture is abundant near the surface. title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarctica‚Äôs Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular berg‚Äîone of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientists‚Äîis sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Island‚Äîabout 4,000 square kilometers.
